Budget.title: Budget
Budget.shortDescription: Here's what we found for you...

1.title: The 50/30/20 Plan
1.description: The 50/30/20 rule is a simple budgeting method. It suggests spending 50% of your income on essentials like housing and food, 30% on wants such as entertainment, and 20% on savings and debt repayment. This helps you manage your money by balancing needs, wants, and future security.

2.title: Create a budget to pay off debt
2.description: Consider methods of budgetting that can help you pay off debt. This can include the snowball method, avalanche method, or the 50/30/20 rule.

3.title: Looking towards retirement?
3.description: Investigate the zero-based budgeting method. This method is a way of budgeting where your income minus your expenses equals zero. That's every dollar of your income assigned a job. This method can help you save for retirement.

6.title: Understanding your debt
6.description: Check out nerdwallet and other resources to understand your debt and how to pay it off. Ensure you know which debt relief method is best for you. Be mindful of scams and predatory lenders.

7.title: Credit Card debt is stressful, talk to a professional
7.description: Speaking to a credit coumselor give you peace of mind and help you understand your options. They can help you budget, connect you with educational resources, and help you negotiate with creditors. Ensure you find a credible credit counselor who is transparent about fees and licensing.
